Description: Spindle, a smooth wooden stick varying in diameter along its length. A small stick is inserted through a hole towards one end to hold the whorl on the spindle. The whorl is a shallow conical disc, lathe-turned. A scrap of cotton is wound round between the whorl and the stop-stick.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), house 785 room 8 level 9
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
